snippet: Afghan officials hope to curb the problem before it further depletes the nascent air force and jeopardizes millions of dollars in American training efforts.
abstract: Desertion of Afghan airmen sent to United States for training is compromising fledgling Afghan Air Force's progress; Afghanistan has had to call on American air support to quell resurgence of violence; officials cite high cost of desertions and move to tighten method of selecting and securing loyalty of trainees.

byline.contributor: Jawad Sukhanyar, Ahmad Shakib and Rod Nordland contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Afghan officials hope to curb the problem before it further depletes the nascent air force and jeopardizes millions of dollars in American training efforts.
